result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvador Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including mandatory DNA surcharge pursuant to Sec.973.046(1r), Wis. Stats.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

No contact with the victim. No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before February 6, 2015 @ 8:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Salvador Hernandez in court with attorney Anthony Flitcroft.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prelminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDED ON 07-11-2014 REMOVING CASH COMPONENT.  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.B. OR S.K. NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR EMMANUEL HERNANDEZ.
Upon motion of the State, cash component is removed from the bond.
Defendant Salvador Hernandez in court in custody wtih attorney Anthony Flitcroft. Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by the State is granted. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.
